article.title: The architecture and formation of the Kepler-30 planetary system

multiple_choice_question.text: Which planet in the Kepler-30 system exhibits the largest TTV amplitude?
choices: Kepler-30b
Kepler-30c
Kepler-30d
All planets have similar TTV amplitudes

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate average difference in mid-transit times between the Holczer et al. (H16) catalogue and the re-analysed data (TTP17)?
choices: 20 minutes
10 minutes
1 minute
30 minutes

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the convergence of the MEGNO indicator to a value of 2 imply about the Kepler-30 system?
choices: The system is dynamically unstable and chaotic.
The system is in a stable, quasi-periodic configuration.
The system is in a resonant state.
The system is undergoing significant orbital evolution.

multiple_choice_question.text: Where is the best-fitting Kepler-30 system located in the (a2, e2) REM dynamical map?
choices: Inside the 2:1 MMR region
In a stable zone, separated from low-order MMRs
Within a region of high dynamical instability
Near a three-body MMR

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the term  −(vi −vc,i) / (κ−1iτi)  in the migration force (fmigr,i) represent?
choices: Gravitational force from the host star
Eccentricity damping due to the protoplanetary disk
Influence of other planets in the system
Tidal forces from the host star
